revisions.rev:
{{Infobox NFL season | logo = | team = New York Giants | year = 2011 | record = 6â6 | division_place= 2nd [[NFC East]] | coach = [[ Tom Coughlin]] | general manager = | stadium = [[MetLife Stadium]] | training camp = New York Giants logo.svg | playoffs = TBD | pro bowlers = TBD | AP All-pros = TBD | uniform = | next = 2012 }} The '''[[2011 NFL season|2011]] [[New York Giants]] season''' is the 87th season for the team in the [[National Football League]]. The Giants finished with a 10â6 record in 2010 however they missed the playoffs. They will play all of their home games at [[MetLife Stadium]] in [[East Rutherford, New Jersey]]. {{TOC limit|3}} ==Offseason== ===2011 draft board=== {{Main|2011 NFL Draft}} [[Todd McShay]] (ESPN),{{cite web|author=Wes O'Donnell |url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/672048-todd-mcshay-2011-nfl-mock-draft-grading-espn-experts-latest-mock/entry/68743-todd-mcshay-2011-nfl-mock-draft-mcshay-pegs-ny-giants-with-ot-gabe-carimi |title=Todd McShay 2011 NFL Mock Draft: McShay Pegs N.Y. Giants with OT Gabe Carimi |publisher=Bleacher Report |date=April 20, 2011 |accessdate=April 26, 2011}} Steve Wyche (NFL.com),{{cite web|last=Wyche |first=Steve |url=http://www.nfl.com/draft/2011/mock-drafts/steve-wyche/60102|title=Mock Draft 2011|publisher=Nfl.com |year=April 25, 2011|accessdate=April 26, 2011}} [[Pat Kirwan]] of NFL.com, New Era Scouting, and DraftKing.com predicted that the Giants would use their first round pick to draft [[Gabe Carimi]], a left tackle for the Wisconsin Badgers who won the 2010 [[Outland Trophy]] as the nation's top collegiate interior lineman, and was a Consensus All-American.{{cite news|url=http://www.nfl.com/draft/story/09000d5d81ebf6c2/article/defense-rules-early-in-a-look-at-the-first-two-rounds?module=HP_cp2 |title=Defense rules early in a look at the first two rounds |publisher=Nfl.com |author=Pat Kirwan |date=March 13, 2011 |accessdate=March 18, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.newerascouting.com/mock-draft/ |title=Mock Draft |publisher=New Era Scouting |date=March 28, 2011 |author= |accessdate=April 2, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.draftking.com/nfl/2011/mockdraft.shtml |title=2011 NFL Mock Draft |publisher=Draft King |date= |author= |accessdate=2011-03-26}} Charles Davis of NFL.com predicted that they would draft [[Mike Pouncey]], a center/offensive guard from the University of Florida.{{cite news|url=http://www.nfl.com/news/story/09000d5d81e9431a/article/postcombine-projection-has-panthers-taking-aim-at-newton |title=Post-combine projection has Panthers taking aim at Newton |publisher=Nfl.com |date=March 2, 2011 |author=Charles Davis |accessdate=March 18, 2011}} Despite a current work stoppage, a provision in the now-expired CBA ensured that the 2011 NFL Draft would still take place. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |- ! Round !! Selection !! Player !! Position !! College |- ! 1 || 19 | [[Prince Amukamara]] || [[Cornerback|CB]] || [[Nebraska Cornhuskers football|Nebraska]] |- ! 2 || 52 | [[Marvin Austin]] || [[Defensive tackle|DT]] || [[North Carolina Tar Heels football|North Carolina]] |- ! 3 || 83 | [[Jerrel Jernigan]] || [[Wide receiver|WR]] || [[Troy Trojans football|Troy]] |- ! 4 || 117 | [[James Brewer (American football)|James Brewer]] || [[Offensive Tackle|OT]] || [[Indiana Hoosiers football|Indiana]] |- ! 5 || {{ref|Sage Rosenfels acquired from Vikings|[a]}} | || || |- ! 6 || 185 | [[Greg Jones (linebacker, born 1988)|Greg Jones]] || [[Linebacker|LB]] || [[Michigan State Spartans football|Michigan State]] |- ! rowspan="2"| 6 || 198 {{ref|Compensatory selection|[b]}} | [[Tyler Sash]] || [[Safety (American football position)|S]] || [[Iowa Hawkeyes football|Iowa]] |- ! 202 {{ref|Compensatory selection|[b]}} | [[Jacquian Williams]] || [[Linebacker|LB]] || [[South Florida Bulls football|South Florida]] |- ! 7 || 221 | [[Da'Rel Scott]] || [[Running back|RB]] || [[Maryland Terrapins football|Maryland]] |} :{{note|Sage Rosenfels acquired from Vikings|[a]}} The Giants traded its fifth-round selection (#150 overall) and a [[2012 NFL Draft|2012]] conditional draft selection to the [[Minnesota Vikings]] in exchange for [[Running back|RB]] [[Darius Reynaud]] and [[Quarterback|QB]] [[Sage Rosenfels]]. :{{note|Compensatory selection|[b]}} [[National Football League Draft#Compensatory picks|Compensatory selection]]. ==Players== ===Movement=== In the first week of the offseason the Giants signed some road free agents and former members of their 2010 practice squad to reserve/future contracts in order to bolster the roster for the 2011 season. In early March the team signed potential free agents to contract extensions: on March 2 the team signed [[running back]] [[D.J. Ware]] to a two-year extension and on March 3 they signed [[wide receiver]]s [[Domenik Hixon]] and [[Darius Reynaud]] to one and two-year extensions, respectively. They also offered tenders to some of their [[restricted free agent]]s but the effectiveness of these tenders rely on the ongoing CBA talks. ===Free agents=== {| class="wikitable" |- !Position || Player || Free agency

text-align:center;" | RB || [[DJ Ware]] || RFA || March 2, 2011 || New York Giants |- style= style="text-align:center;" | LB || [[Gerris Wilkinson]] || UFA || || Jacksonville Jaguars |- style= style="text-align:center;" |- |colspan="5"|''RFA'': [[Restricted free agent]], ''UFA'': [[Unrestricted free agents|Unrestricted free agent]], ''ERFA'': [[Exclusive-rights free agent|Exclusive rights free agent]] |} ===Roster=== {{New York Giants roster}} ==Staff== ===Staff changes=== *On March 9, 2011 the assistant special teams [[Thomas McGaughey]] accepted a job in the [[Louisiana State University]] as special teams/defensive line coach of their football team. He was with the Giants since 2007. *On June 24, 2011 it was reported that [[Larry Izzo]] will become the Giants' new assistant special teams coach once the NFL Lockout has ceased.{{cite web|author=Mike Garafolo |url=http://www.nj.com/giants/index.ssf/2011/06/giants_to_hire_former_jet_patr.html |title= Giants to hire former Jet, Patriot Larry Izzo as assistant special teams coach |publisher=nj.com |date=June 24, 2011 |accessdate=July 16, 2011}} {| class="toccolours" style="text-align: left;" |- ! colspan="7" style="background:#192f6b; color:white; text-align: center; border:2px solid #CA0019;"|'''New York Giants 2010 staff''' |- | style="font-size:95%; vertical-align:top;"| '''Front Office''' *President/CEO â [[John Mara]] *Chairman/Executive Vice President â [[Steve Tisch]] *Senior Vice President/General Manager â [[Jerry Reese]] *Vice President of Player Evaluation â [[Chris Mara]] *Assistant General Manager â [[Kevin Abrams (American football)|Kevin Abrams]] *Director of Pro Personnel â [[David Gettleman]] *Director of College Scouting â [[Marc Ross]] *Assistant Director of Pro Personnel â [[Ken Sternfeld]] '''Head Coaches''' *Head Coach â [[Tom Coughlin]] '''Offensive Coaches''' *Offensive Coordinator â [[Kevin Gilbride]] *Quarterbacks â [[Mike Sullivan (football coach)|Mike Sullivan]] *Running Backs â [[Jerald Ingram]] *Wide Receivers â [[Sean Ryan (football coach)|Sean Ryan]] *Tight Ends â [[Mike Pope]] *Offensive Line â [[Pat Flaherty (football coach)|Pat Flaherty]] *Assistant Offensive Line â [[Jack Bicknell, Jr.]] *Offensive Quality Control â [[Kevin Gilbride, Jr.]] |width="35"|  |valign="top"| | style="font-size:95%; vertical-align:top;"| '''Defensive Coaches''' *Defensive Coordinator â [[Perry Fewell]] *Defensive Line â [[Robert Nunn]] *Linebackers â [[Jim Herrmann]] *Secondary/Cornerbacks â [[Peter Giunta]] *Secondary/Safeties â [[David Merritt (American football)|David Merritt]] *Defensive Quality Control â [[Al Holcomb]] '''Special Team Coaches''' *Special Teams Coordinator â [[Tom Quinn (football coach)|Tom Quinn]] *Assistant Special Teams â [[Larry Izzo (football coach)|Larry Izzo]] '''Strength and Conditioning''' *Strength and Conditioning â [[Jerry Palmieri]] *Assistant Strength and Conditioning â [[Markus Paul]] |} ==Schedule== ===Preseason=== The Giants' preseason schedule was announced on April 12, 2011. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 92%;" "align=center" |- ! TD, 2 INT ;Top rushers * NYG â Brandon Jacobs â 18 CAR, 72 YDS, TD * NE â [[BenJarvus Green-Ellis]] â 12 CAR, 52 YDS ;Top receivers * NYG â Victor Cruz â 6 REC, 91 YDS * NE â [[Wes Welker]] â 9 REC, 136 YDS ;Top tacklers * NYG â Mathias Kiwanuka â 6 TKL, 6 AST, INT * NE â [[Rob Ninkovich]] â 4 TKL, 3 AST }} In the rematch of [[Super Bowl XLII]], Tom Brady was picked off in Giants territory early in the game. With the ball at the New York 29, Brady's pass was tipped by Michael Boley and intercepted by Mathias Kiwanuka, who returned it to the Giants 28, for Brady's 2nd pick of the game. However, the next possession had the Patriots drive down to the Giants 12. Stephen Gostowski's 27-yard field goal went slight left, making this the first time the Patriots had no score at halftime since December 10, 2006. In this game, turnovers marred both teams. First, Lawrence Tynes kicked a 22-yard field goal that put them on 3â0. Then Brandon Jacobs ran it in 10 yards to put the Giants up 10â0. After that, Aaron Ross muffed the punt, giving the Patriots the ball at the Giants 33. However, they could only muster a 32-yard field goal. Devin Thomas muffed his punt, but scooped it up. Then, Julian Edelman fumbled the punt in Giants territory. Driving in the red zone, Manning got picked off by Kyle Arrington in the end zone. Seven plays later, Brady hit Aaron Hernandez for a 5-yard touchdown, tying the game at 10 just 32 seconds into the fourth quarter. With 7:08, Gostowski's 45-yard field goal gave the Pats their first lead of the game, 13â10. Manning then led the Giants on an 85-yard march to a 10-yard touchdown pass to Mario Manningham with 3:03 remaining, putting the Giants on top 17â13. It looked like the Pats would win with a comeback of their own when Tom Brady threw a 14-yard pass to Rob Gronkowski, making it 20â17 with 1:36 to go. However, leading the New York Giants 80 yards in just over a minute, Manning hit Jake Ballard for a 1-yard touchdown with 15 seconds left for a 24â20 win on Sunday, repeating a come-from-behind victory similar to the 2008 title game between the teams. They were helped by a 20-yard pass interference penalty against safety Sergio Brown of the Patriots (5â3) that put the ball at the 1 with 30 seconds left. ===Week 10: at San Francisco 49ers=== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|New York Giants}};
